sentence.Network_en: Never in his life had he gazed on such splendor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他生平从没有见过如此辉煌壮丽的场面.

sentence.Network_en: The author tried to depict the splendor of the sunset.
sentence.Network_cn: 作家试图摹写落日的光彩.

sentence.Network_en: All the splendor in the world is not worth a good friend.
sentence.Network_cn: 人世间所有的荣华富贵不如一个好朋友。

means.word_mean: 1. a quality that outshines the usual
2. the quality of being magnificent or splendid or grand

auth_sentence.content: Thursday, the attire called for black tie and timeless splendor.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thursday, the attire called for black tie and timeless splendor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thursday, the attire called for black tie and timeless splendor.

auth_sentence.content: The Roan Plateau in western Colorado is known for its natural splendor.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Roan Plateau in western Colorado is known for its natural splendor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Roan Plateau in western Colorado is known for its natural splendor.

auth_sentence.content: Instead, the Clouds owe much of their splendor to each other.
auth_sentence.res_content: Instead, the Clouds owe much of their splendor to each other.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Instead, the Clouds owe much of their splendor to each other.

stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+splend光辉+ent……的→再光辉→辉煌的
splend发光+id……的→adj.壮丽的,辉煌的;极好的

sentences.en: The house has been restored to its original splendor.
sentences.cn: 这座房子已经恢复了当初的光彩。

sentences.en: I’ve only just discovered the splendors of the English countryside.
sentences.cn: 我刚刚发现英国乡村的景色如此壮美。

sentences.en: The castle rises in solitary splendor on the fringe of the desert.
sentences.cn: 这座城堡巍然耸立在沙漠的边际，显得十分壮美。

sentences.en: There below lay Paris in all its splendor.
sentences.cn: 那下面就是光彩夺目的巴黎。

sentences.en: A butterfly emerged in its full splendor a week later.
sentences.cn: 一周后蝴蝶破茧而出，绚丽夺目。

sentences.en: It will take a lot of repair work before the theatre regains its former splendor.
sentences.cn: 要想剧院重拾昔日的辉煌，必须进行大规模整修。

sentences.en: The hotel has the splendor of a nineteenth-century mansion.
sentences.cn: 这家旅馆具有19 世纪豪宅的华丽风格。

sentences.en: They dined in a special suite in glorious splendor.
sentences.cn: 他们在一间富丽堂皇的套房里进餐。
